channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [TEZ-3611] Create lightweight summary events for ATS.
item.description:
All DAG*Event are summary logs. DAGSubmittedEvent has dagPlan in it and DAGFinishedEvent has counters in it. And hence these events very large, which makes the dag landing page on the tez-ui very expensive.

Split these events into two parts:

  • One which contains only data used by the tez-ui "All Dags" page which will go into summary log.
  • Another which will contain the current object, which will be part of the appropriate TimelineEntityGroupId.
item.summary: Create lightweight summary events for ATS.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Created TEZ_DAG_PLAN entity and split the DAGSubmittedEvent to be sent as two entities, TEZ_DAG_ID which contains existing data without dagPlan and TEZ_DAG_PLAN which contains only the dagPlan.

This change is only made for ATSv15, since ATSv1 does not have concept of summary events. Should I make it consistent for both?

Leaving the counters as suggested by sseth to ensure the UI can display them in the "All Dags" page.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12852055/TEZ-3611.01.patch
against master revision e1b0b28.

-1 patch. master compilation may be broken.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-TEZ-Build/2252//console

This message is automatically generated.
Changed the entity name to be TEZ_DAG_EXTRA_INFO, which we can use to move counters too.

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12852535/TEZ-3611.02.patch
against master revision e1b0b28.

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 2 new or modified test files.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. There were no new javadoc warning messages.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 3.0.1) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-TEZ-Build/2258//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-TEZ-Build/2258//console

This message is automatically generated.

Removing the counters is probably the biggest gain. Though we should not do it earlier because they are used on the main listing page. Polled some people about the usefulness of the counters on the main listing page - noone had used them. Given we can't list a lot of dags on the main listing page, I suspect the counters are not very useful. Given this feedback, we should remove the counters also.

cc jeagles, rohini - do you use counters on the main dag listing page? We'd like to get rid of these so that the listing page load time improves. If they're used, I think we should create a separate page which gets this information.
Moved counters from DAGFinishedEvent into DAG_EXTRA_INFO entity.

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12853043/TEZ-3611.03.patch
against master revision dcae5e4.

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 2 new or modified test files.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. There were no new javadoc warning messages.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 3.0.1) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-TEZ-Build/2264//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-TEZ-Build/2264//console

This message is automatically generated.

do you use counters on the main dag listing page

Do you mean the All DAGs page? Till now did not realize it was possible to compare counters across DAGs in that page. If I had known would have used it when comparing different runs of a script (Filtering on the DAG name). Possible to keep that feature but turned off based on a config? I am fine it being turned off by default. Would like to keep it turned on in our deployment. Many users have data varying through the day for the hourly runs and many would be find it useful to do quick comparison for the different hourly DAGs with those counters.

Till now did not realize it was possible to compare counters across DAGs in that page.

Sad. Probably we must create a doc on using Tez UI, with things possible.

Think Sreenath was suggesting offline about fetching the counter data on demand when such comparison is required. So main load times are fast, and the on demand fetch takes care of the cases where a comparison is required - based on the dags displayed.
Thats true, its planned as part of TEZ-3631.

Minor comments on the patch.

  • Should we have HistoryEventTimelineConversion return a list from convertToTimelineEntity - instead of exposing summary vs non-summary events in this class?
  • Nothing invokes convertToTimelineEntity with a value of false? (That was for backward compatibility of the UI I believe?)

Question: This puts DAG_EXTRA_INFO into the regular details file, correct? Does it make sense to put DAG_EXTRA_INFO into the summary as well, (except not part of DAG_ID - This is really just to get past the inability to retrieve specific fields from ATS).

Other than this, changes look good to me.

Think we need to wait for the UI part of the change to be in place before committing this?

Unrelated question: I didn't realize there's additional information like Vertex list (without task count) logged as part of TEZ_DAG_ID. Assuming all the events - recovery, dag initialized, etc - all pubish to ATS summry, since they all update TEZ_DAG_ID?

Thanks @sseth.

  • I'll make the change to return a list of event instead of a single event and remove special handling of summary events. I made the changes to keep HistoryEventTimelineConversion's API backwards compatible. Might not be a requirement, please do confirm.
  • The convertToTimelineEntity with false is being invoked by ATSHistoryLoggingService. I can make the same changes there and keep both loggers consisted w.r.t data format for ATS.

Yes, this puts the DAG_EXTRA_INFO into regular details file. The summary file is used to get information for dag listing page where information in DAG_EXTRA_INFO is not used. It helps by keeping the summary file small and search and load would be faster on it.

Yes, this change will break the UI and we need to ensure that UI can work with both formats of logging.

Yes, the entity type TEZ_DAG_ID is a summary entity type, so all events to this entity Dag(submitted, intialized, started, finished, recovered)Events are published into summary logs.

I'll make the change to return a list of event instead of a single event and remove special handling of summary events. I made the changes to keep HistoryEventTimelineConversion's API backwards compatible. Might not be a requirement, please do confirm.

Is there a reason to make it compatible? It's not marked prIvate / public.

The convertToTimelineEntity with false is being invoked by ATSHistoryLoggingService. I can make the same changes there and keep both loggers consisted w.r.t data format for ATS.

Sounds good. Wonder if we should get rid of ATSHistoryLoggingService at some point.

Thanks sseth. Addressing comments:

  • HistoryEventTimelineConversion returns a list of events.
  • ATSHistoryLoggingService and ATSV15HistoryLoggingService log events are same now.

sseth I do not think we can remove ATSHistoryLoggingService, since hadoop 2.6 does not have acls.

+1. After precommit fixes.

I do not think we can remove ATSHistoryLoggingService, since hadoop 2.6 does not have acls.

Makes sense.

Fixed ATSImportTool to be compatible with earlier and current logging formats.

rajesh.balamohan Please tell me if the fix is fine. Currently I have taken the approach of merging the data from TEZ_DAG_EXTRA_INFO into the "dag" json. Another approach is to add TEZ_DAG_EXTRA_INFO as another file in the zip and then change the processing in ATSFileParser/BaseParser to handle this case.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: DAGPlan and Counters were moved out of TEZ_DAG_ID entity into DAG_EXTRA_INFO entity.
